alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 12:23PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Kanawha, southwestern Putnam, northeastern Lincoln and northwestern Boone Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tornado, or 8 miles east of Hamlin, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Madison, St. Albans, Alum Creek, Tornado, Julian, Danville, Sweetland, Sod, Woodville, Ashford, Foster, Griffithsville, Alkol, and Yawkey. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 48 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
